news.title: ReLU vs ELU: Picking the Right Activation for Deep Nets
news.description:
Introduction

Activation functions are one of the key factors behind the success of deep learning. They are non‑linear transforms that give artificial neural networks the power to model complex relationships. Without them, each layer would multiply inputs by weights and add biases, resulting in a li...
news.author: Adrien Payong

news.title: How To Install and Secure Redis on Ubuntu
news.description:
Introduction

Redis is an in-memory key-value store known for its flexibility, performance, and wide language support. It is frequently used as a database, cache, and message broker. While a default installation is functional, it is not secure and leaves your data and server exposed to attack. An un...
news.author: Mark Drake

news.title: Intel's Open-Source Strategy Is Changing At Odds With The Ethos Of Open-Source
news.description: For the past 21+ years of running Phoronix and even longer than that being a Linux user, I have loved and consistently promoted Intel's open-source efforts and leading Linux support.

news.title: New FileFix attack uses cache smuggling to evade security software
news.description: A new variant of the FileFix social engineering attack uses cache smuggling to secretly download a malicious ZIP archive onto a victim's system and bypassing security software.
news.author: Lawrence Abrams

news.title: The Top 20 Problems With Batch Processing (and How to Fix Them With Data Streaming)
news.description: Batch processing has long been the default approach for moving and transforming data in enterprise systems. It works on fixed schedules, processes data in large chunks, and often relies on complex chains of jobs that run overnight. While this was acceptable in the past, today's digital businesses op...

news.title: Qilin ransomware claims Asahi brewery attack, leaks data
news.description: The Qilin ransomware group has claimed responsibility for the attack at Japanese beer maker Asahi, adding the company to its extortion page on the dark web yesterday.
news.author: Bill Toulas

news.title: Microsoft 365 outage blocks access to Teams, Exchange Online
news.description: ​Microsoft is working to resolve an ongoing outage preventing users from accessing Microsoft 365 services, including Microsoft Teams, Exchange Online, and the admin center.
news.author: Sergiu Gatlan

news.title: Linux 6.18 USB Brings Intel USBIO Drivers, Offload Improvements
news.description: In addition to the Linux 6.18 kernel bringing initial bindings for writing Rust USB drivers, the main USB/Thunderbolt subsystem updates for Linux 6.18 brought a variety of other enhancements.
news.author: @michaellarabel

news.title: Microsoft enables Exchange Online auto-archiving by default
news.description: Microsoft is enabling threshold-based auto-archiving by default in Exchange Online to prevent email flow issues caused by mailboxes filling up faster than expected.
news.author: Sergiu Gatlan

news.title: Crimson Collective hackers target AWS cloud instances for data theft
news.description: The 'Crimson Collective' threat group has been targeting AWS (Amazon Web Services) cloud environments for the past weeks, to steal data and extort companies.
news.author: Bill Toulas

news.title: Theia Deep Dive, Part 1: From Zero to Your Own IDE
news.description:

There are countless reasons to create your own IDE. Perhaps you are creating a sandbox similar to CodeSandbox, but adapted to your own framework. Or an Arduino-style environment where a strictly controlled user interface is required for flashing firmware and interactin...

news.title: Hackers exploit auth bypass in Service Finder WordPress theme
news.description: Threat actors are actively exploiting a critical vulnerability in the Service Finder WordPress theme that allows them to bypass authentication and log in as administrators.
news.author: Bill Toulas
